definition: to break down/to break into pieces/fragmentary

to fall/to drop/to lag behind/to lose/to go missing/to reduce/fall (in prices)/to lose (value, weight etc)/to wag/to swing/to turn/to change/to exchange/to swap/to show off/to shed (hair)/(used after certain verbs to express completion, fulfillment, removal etc)

sentences.english: Chop peanuts, or crush them with the side of a knife, or pulse them in a food processor to chop roughly.
sentences.chinese: 碎掉的花生或是用刀柄将他们押碎，大致弄碎就是了。

sentences.english: Bits of glass sprayed everywhere when the vase hit the floor and shattered.
sentences.chinese: 那只花瓶摔到地板碎掉后，玻璃碎片喷得到处都是。

sentences.english: Who can give me a gentle hug.
sentences.chinese: 谁能给我温柔拥抱，我感觉心快要碎掉了。

sentences.english: Almost every time a character throws something away you can hear a glass braking.
sentences.chinese: 几乎每次有角色扔东西时你都能听到玻璃碎掉的声音。

definition: to disintegrate/to shatter into small pieces
to break down/to break into pieces/fragmentary
to shatter/to smash/to break into pieces
to rupture/to burst open/to break up
to destroy in an explosion/to break (by bombing)
all split up and in pieces (idiom); disunity (in an organization)/complete lack of unity/to disintegrate/falling apart/to be at sixes and sevens
